intro: Hieracium mesopsilum, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium mesopsilum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
